ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Respondent - Other (text)
Please indicate which one you have chosen (select one)
Notes: 1 = Mother; 2 = Father; 3 = Stepmother; 4 = Stepfather; 5 = Foster-parent; 6 = Guardian; 7 = Other

ElementDescription: Do you live with the identified caregiver?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Within the past three months, how often have you talked with the identified caregiver, either in person or on the phone?
Notes: 1 = Every day; 2 = Several times a week; 3 = About once a week; 4 = 2 or 3 times a month; 5 = Once a month; 6 = Less than once a month

ElementDescription: Please think of one very close friend. Which is this person? Same sex or opposite sex?
Notes: 1 = Same sex; 2 = Opposite sex

ElementDescription: What is the identified friend's age in years?
Within the past three months, how often have you talked with your friend, either in person or on the phone? (Select one)
Notes: 1 = Every day; 2 = Several times a week; 3 = About once a week; 4 = 2 or 3 times a month; 5 = Once a month; 6 = Less than once a month

ElementDescription: Is the identified friend currently a UCLA student?
Notes: 0 = No and never was; 1 = Yes; 3 = Already graduated

ElementDescription: Are you currently in a romantic relationship that has been going on for three months or more?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: What is the length of time you have been together in this romantic relationship?  Years
What is the length of time you have been together in this romantic relationship?  Months
What is the most accurate description of this relationship? (select one)
Notes: 1 = Married; 2 = Engaged; 3 = See only one another; 4 = See others too

ElementDescription: At certain times, we want information or advice about school or work-related concerns (e.g., what courses to take this term, or how to approach the boss in asking for a raise, etc.) For example, we might want information about a particular problem, or advice in making an important decision. Within the past three months, how often have you desired information or advice from others concerning school or work?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; 5 = Very Often

ElementDescription: How often did your parent provide information or advice about school or work in the past three months (whether you wanted it or not)?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; 5 = Very Often

ElementDescription: How often did your friend provide information or advice about school or work in the past three months (whether you wanted it or not)?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; 5 = Very Often

ElementDescription: How often did your romantic partner provide information or advice about school or work in the past three months (whether you wanted it or not)? (SKIP IF NONE)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; 5 = Very Often

ElementDescription: At certain times, we want information or advice about our relationship with another person, or others in general (e.g., conflict with someone, concerns about others' opinions, developing a new relationship, etc.) Within the past three months, how often have you desired information or advice from others concerning your relationships?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; 5 = Very Often

ElementDescription: How often did your parent provide information or advice about your relationship with another person within the past three months (whether you wanted it or not)?

ElementDescription: At certain times, we want minor assistance, like help with a small task (e.g., doing laundry, a ride somewhere close by, help with a project at work, help with a homework assignment, etc.) or we want some small material things (e.g., a small amount of money such as $5 or a small item). Within the past three months, how often have you desired such minor assistance?

How satisfied are you with the amount of visiting you do in person with your parents?
Notes: 0=Very dissatisfied (I wish things were very different); 1=Somewhat dissatisfied (I would like some changes); 2=Somewhat satisfied (OK for now, pretty good); 3=Very satisfied (I''m really pleased); 4=Not Applicable; 9999=Choose not to answer

ElementDescription: How satisfied are you with the amount of phone visiting you do with your spouse/partners''s parents (in-laws)?
Notes: 0=Very dissatisfied (I wish things were very different); 1=Somewhat dissatisfied (I would like some changes); 2=Somewhat satisfied (OK for now, pretty good); 3=Very satisfied (I''m really pleased); 4=Not Applicable; 9999=Choose not to answer

ElementDescription: How satisfied are you with the amount of visiting you do in person with your spouse/partner''s parents (in-laws)?
Notes: 0=Very dissatisfied (I wish things were very different); 1=Somewhat dissatisfied (I would like some changes); 2=Somewhat satisfied (OK for now, pretty good); 3=Very satisfied (I''m really pleased); 4=Not Applicable; 9999=Choose not to answer

ElementDescription: How satisfied are you with the amount of visiting (phone or in person) you do with family members other than parents?
Notes: 0=Very dissatisfied (I wish things were very different); 1=Somewhat dissatisfied (I would like some changes); 2=Somewhat satisfied (OK for now, pretty good); 3=Very satisfied (I''m really pleased); 4=Not Applicable; 9999=Choose not to answer

ElementDescription: How satisfied are you with the amount of help (as babysitters, sources of information, sympathetic ears) family members provide?
Notes: 0=Very dissatisfied (I wish things were very different); 1=Somewhat dissatisfied (I would like some changes); 2=Somewhat satisfied (OK for now, pretty good); 3=Very satisfied (I''m really pleased); 4=Not Applicable; 9999=Choose not to answer

ElementDescription: How satisfied are you with whether you have someone you can share your most private feelings with?
Notes: 0=Very dissatisfied (I wish things were very different); 1=Somewhat dissatisfied (I would like some changes); 2=Somewhat satisfied (OK for now, pretty good); 3=Very satisfied (I''m really pleased); 4=Not Applicable; 9999=Choose not to answer

ElementDescription: If you have a relationship with a spouse or partner, how satisfied are you with this situation?
Notes: 0=Very dissatisfied (I wish things were very different); 1=Somewhat dissatisfied (I would like some changes); 2=Somewhat satisfied (OK for now, pretty good); 3=Very satisfied (I''m really pleased); 4=Not Applicable; 9999=Choose not to answer

ElementDescription: Do you now have a relationship with a spouse or partner? Do you expect it will continue for the years to come?
Notes: 0=I don''t have a relationship; 1=I don''t expect the relationship to last; 2=I feel the relationship will probably last; 3=I feel the relationship will definitely last; 9999=Choose not to answer

ElementDescription: When you take everything into consideration - you child, your adult life, etc. - how would you describe your current life situation?
Notes: 0=Things are very bad right now; 1=Things are fairly bad right now; 2=Things are ok - not bad and not good; 3=Things are fairly good; 4=Things are very good; 9999=Choose not to answer

ElementDescription: How satisfied are you with your involvement in your neighborhood?
Notes: 0=Very dissatisfied (I wish things were very different); 1=Somewhat dissatisfied (I would like some changes); 2=Somewhat satisfied (OK for now, pretty good); 3=Very satisfied (I''m really pleased); 4=Not Applicable; 9999=Choose not to answer

ElementDescription: How satisfied are you with any organized groups (for example: church, social, education or sports groups) that are a source of support for you?
Notes: 0=Very dissatisfied (I wish things were very different); 1=Somewhat dissatisfied (I would like some changes); 2=Somewhat satisfied (OK for now, pretty good); 3=Very satisfied (I''m really pleased); 4=Not Applicable; 9999=Choose not to answer

Notes: 0=Very dissatisfied (I wish things were very different); 1=Somewhat dissatisfied (I would like some changes); 2=Somewhat satisfied (OK for now, pretty good); 3=Very satisfied (I''m really pleased); 4=Not Applicable; 9999=Choose not to answer

Notes: 0=Very dissatisfied (I wish things were very different); 1=Somewhat dissatisfied (I would like some changes); 2=Somewhat satisfied (OK for now, pretty good); 3=Very satisfied (I''m really pleased); 4=Not Applicable; 9999=Choose not to answer

ElementDescription: If you were to become upset or angry, would you have someone to talk honestly to, who is not involved? How satisfied are you with this situation?
Notes: 0=Very dissatisfied (I wish things were very different); 1=Somewhat dissatisfied (I would like some changes); 2=Somewhat satisfied (OK for now, pretty good); 3=Very satisfied (I''m really pleased); 4=Not Applicable; 9999=Choose not to answer

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Treatment group
Notes: e.g., Control, Intervention, Experimental, Placebo

ElementDescription: Do you have an adult person in your life who you regularly connect with and who is supportive of you? This is someone that you see, call, text or otherwise connect with at least three times a week.
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes 888=Don''t Know; 999=Refuse

ElementDescription: Does your main support person currently use heroin or have a problem with pain pills or other opioids?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes; 777=Not Applicable; 888=Don''t Know; 999=Refuse

ElementDescription: How much do you feel listened to by those in your personal life?
Notes: 1 = Not enough; 2 = Enough or more than enough

ElementDescription: How much do you feel that there are people in your life who understand your problems?
Notes: 1 = Not enough; 2 = Enough or more than enough
